poem:
Control at the Telegraph

RedBird, like quicksilver,  
seeks to grasp pages  
old as dust, yet restless.  
Gerry's ink-stained hands  
craft whispers into action,  
soothing the correspondence  
of paralysis with promises.  
Confidence colors the waiting  
air red; a dyer's heart bleeds  
through crisp, folded wings.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "RedBird Capital confident of tabling a deal to take control of Telegraph The US private equity firm RedBird Capital is confident of tabling a deal to take control of the Daily and Sunday Telegraph as soon as next month, in an attempt to end two years of “paralysis and unhappiness” at the 170-year-old titles. The firm’s founder, Gerry Cardinale, is personally involved in drafting a plan to either form a consortium or self-fund a takeover". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: RedBird Capital confident of tabling a deal to take control of Telegraph The US private equity firm RedBird Capital is confident of tabling a deal to take control of the Daily and Sunday Telegraph as soon as next month, in an attempt to end two years of “paralysis and unhappiness” at the 170-year-old titles. The firm’s founder, Gerry Cardinale, is personally involved in drafting a plan to either form a consortium or self-fund a takeover
